meanings.definition: The ability to feel or perceive things.
meanings.sent1: Her sensibility allowed her to understand the emotions of others.
meanings.sent2: His sensibility to music made him a great pianist.
meanings.sent3: The robot's malfunctioning sensibility led to some comical misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: The artist's painting captured the sensibility of a rainy day perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The sensibility of the character in the novel made the story truly touching.

meanings.definition: Awareness or responsiveness to emotions or feelings.
meanings.sent1: His sensibility towards his friend's sadness was heartwarming.
meanings.sent2: She showed great sensibility in comforting those in need.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's sensibility to his owner's mood changes was remarkable.
meanings.sent4: The city had a sensibility that seemed to echo the emotions of its inhabitants.
meanings.sent5: The sensibility of the poem resonated deeply with the audience.

meanings.definition: A refined or delicate quality in art or literature.
meanings.sent1: The painting displayed a sensibility that was both elegant and profound.
meanings.sent2: The writer's sensibility shone through in every line of the novel.
meanings.sent3: The cake was decorated with a sensibility that made it almost too beautiful to eat.
meanings.sent4: The music had a sensibility that transported the listeners to another world.
meanings.sent5: The sensibility of the sculpture left the viewers in awe of its craftsmanship.
